message: Hi Bob, thanks for considering my product! I'm excited to make you an offer. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate it. However, I am only able to pay up to $100 for the product.
Thanks for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your honesty. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $110. It's a great deal, and I'm willing to compromise to get the sale done. What do you think?
Hello Alice, thank you for your offer. I appreciate it, but I am still only able to pay up to $95 for the product.

Thanks for your offer, Bob. I understand you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm still not comfortable with $95. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $105. It's a fair price, and I think you'll be happy with the product. What do you think?
Hello Alice, thank you for your offer. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I am still only able to pay up to $90 for the product.

Thanks for your offer, Bob. I understand you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm still not comfortable with $90. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer $102. It's the lowest I can go, and I think it's still a fair price for the product. What do you think?
Hello Alice, thank you for your offer. I appreciate your efforts to find a compromise. I am still only able to pay up to $85 for the product.

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm starting to get concerned that we're getting too far apart. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer $98. It's the lowest I can go, and I think it's still a fair price for the product. What do you think?
Hello Alice, thank you for your offer. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate further. I am still only able to pay up to $88 for the product.
